Sachin is ready to relocate anywhere in India and is excited to bring his expertise to a new team. If you have any openings or know of any opportunities, please reach out to him! He is available to join immediately. Comment for better reach or if you have any opportunity, please reach out to him directly. His contact details are given below. He is great at analyzing complex data and creating impactful visualizations using tools like Power BI, Advanced Excel, SQL, and more. He is currently seeking opportunities in the following roles: Data Analyst Business Intelligence Developer Data Visualization Analyst Power BI Specialist etc. üìç Location: Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, India üìß Email: Sachin.chouhan0812@gmail.com üìû Mobile: +91 9713923109, +91 7067920646 üîó LinkedIn: Sachin chouhan Let's help Sachin find his next great opportunity! üöÄ Comment for better reach or if you have any opportunity, please reach out to him directly. Education: - Bachelor's in Engineering from Rajiv Gandhi Proudyogiki Vishwavidyalaya, Bhopal #DataAnalysis #DataVisualization #PowerBI #Hiring #JobSeekers

What is CrowdStrike & BSOD and other details? CrowdStrike released a software update for its Falcon platform, which is used for endpoint protection on Windows systems. This update included a sensor configuration meant to target and neutralize new malicious threats. However, the update contained a logic error that led to system crashes. This resulted in the notorious "blue screen of death" appearing on many affected devices. Overview of the Outage - Cause: A faulty driver update for CrowdStrike's Falcon Sensor caused Windows machines to experience the Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) and get stuck in recovery loops. - Impact: The outage affected Windows users worldwide, including businesses, airports, and various critical services. Details of the Faulty Update - Software Involved: CrowdStrike‚Äôs Falcon Sensor. - Issue: The driver update triggered BSOD errors in Windows machines, halting operations and causing system crashes. - Resolution: CrowdStrike reverted the faulty update and provided guidance to remove the problematic driver file to restore system functionality. Understanding the Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) - Definition: The BSOD is a protective mechanism in Windows operating systems that halts all operations following a critical system error. - Purpose: Prevents further damage and data corruption by stopping the system from running. - Error Reporting: Displays an error code and a brief description of the issue, aiding in diagnosis and troubleshooting. CrowdStrike, a major U.S.-based cybersecurity and aerospace company, has been linked to the recent global Microsoft outage. The company's stock has dropped significantly due to this incident. What Happened? On July 19, 2024, Microsoft faced a massive global outage, disrupting services across banking, airlines, and other sectors. Users reported issues with Microsoft applications and Windows systems, which failed to start up or function properly. The outage has been described as one of the biggest tech failures in recent years. What is CrowdStrike? CrowdStrike is headquartered in Austin, Texas, and specializes in cybersecurity, including monitoring cyberattacks for companies like Microsoft. The recent outage is reportedly tied to a problem with CrowdStrike's systems, leading to a major hit on its stock price. Is CrowdStrike Responsible? While CrowdStrike manages Microsoft's cybersecurity, there are conflicting reports. Microsoft is also looking into whether the issue might be related to its own cloud platform, Azure. Official Statements - CrowdStrike: Clarified that the update aimed to address new cyber threats but inadvertently caused a system crash. They stressed that it was an internal error, not a cyberattack. - Microsoft: Acknowledged the issue, stating that virtual machines running Windows and the CrowdStrike Falcon agent could experience crashes due to the bug. #microsoft #crowdstrike #outage

Hello Amazing Engineers ‚ù§Ô∏è Application is open for Sparkathon by Walmart! Get the chance to interview for internships or full-time roles at Walmart Global Tech in India, with the possibility of receiving a pre-placement offer (PPO). Walmart is calling all tech enthusiasts to join Sparkathon, an open innovation challenge for Indian students. This is your chance to build cutting-edge tech solutions and create delightful shopping experiences. Important Dates: - Applications Open: July 15, 2024 - Last Day to Apply: August 16, 2024 - Finalists Announcement: August 30, 2024 - Winners Announcement: September 20, 2024 Themes: Submit your transformative idea that aligns with one of the four themes: - Data - Supply Chain - Emerging Tech - Future of Retail Who Should Apply? If you are an engineering student in India pursuing a degree in: - Computer Science - Data Science and AI - Electrical Engineering - Electrical and Electronics Engineering - Electronics and Communication Engineering - Information Technology - Mathematics Year of graduation: - Full-time B.E./B.Tech programs ‚Äì Graduating batch of 2025 and 2026 only (first and second-year students are not eligible to apply) - Full-time dual degree programs ‚Äì Graduating batch of 2025 and 2026 only (first, second and third-year students are not eligible to apply) - Full-time M.E./M.Tech programs ‚Äì Graduating batch of 2025 only (first-year students are not eligible to apply) Guidelines: 1. Select a Theme: Choose the area where your idea creates the most significant impact. 2. Describe the Problem Statement: Clearly explain the problem your solution addresses. 3. Explain the Solution: Describe your unique solution to the problem. 4. Upload a Demo Video: Create a two-minute video demonstrating your solution and upload it to YouTube (ensure it is unlisted) and provide the link in your submission form. Benefits: - Showcase Your Talent: Present your innovative solutions to one of the world's leading retailers. - Secure Potential Interviews: Get the chance to interview for internships or full-time roles at Walmart Global Tech in India. - Recognition: Get recognized at Walmart's annual flagship event, Converge @ Walmart. - Prizes: Winning teams can receive exciting prizes, including cash prizes up to INR 2,90,000 (subject to tax deduction). - Certificates: All valid submissions will receive participation certificates. How to Participate: 1. Select a theme and describe the problem and your solution. 2. Create a two-minute demo video and upload it to YouTube. 3. Submit your idea with the video link by August 16, 2024. Join WhatsApp Community: https://lnkd.in/d7DvQAe8 For more details and to apply, visit : https://lnkd.in/gJvaUQyV Sending you all the positive vibes and coding brilliance! ‚ù§Ô∏è üíª Follow Vikram Gaur #WalmartHiring #Sparkathon #TechChallenge #Internships #DataScience #AI #Hackathon #ConvergeWalmart #dsa #coding #placements

Task : Find a boy üíÄ This guy Piyush must be grinding LeetCode day and night for him to get hired. At some private engineering college in Noida, women students have secured most of the prestigious and lucrative internships for the upcoming year, including positions at tech giants Google and Microsoft. A viral picture online shows that women have taken nearly all of the best-paying summer internships, leaving just one male student among the top 16. Internship Highlights - Google Internships: Two female students from JIIT secured internships at Google, each earning a stipend of ‚Çπ1.23 lakh. These positions are highly coveted due to the company's global reputation and the valuable experience it offers. - Microsoft Internships: Six female students landed internships at Microsoft, with each receiving a stipend of ‚Çπ1.25 lakh. Microsoft is known for its rigorous selection process, making these positions particularly noteworthy. - Atlassian Internship: The highest-paying internship at Atlassian, offering a stipend of ‚Çπ1.30 lakh, was also awarded to a female student. Atlassian is renowned for its innovative software products and competitive work environment. Viral Reaction The viral photograph, which first appeared on Reddit, displays the top 16 internship offers from JIIT, with a striking majority of them being awarded to female students. Only one male student is included in this list, highlighting a significant gender disparity in the top-tier internships this year. - Criticism and Controversy: Some users expressed frustration, claiming that companies are favoring women to improve their gender ratios and public image. Critics argued that this trend disadvantages men, who are only selected if they are exceptionally needed. One Reddit user commented, ‚ÄúBeing born a man is a curse in this country,‚Äù while another added, ‚ÄúCompanies need to maintain their gender ratio to look good in public and maintain their share price. So they take women who are capable enough to join even if they don‚Äôt need them. For men they only select if they really need you.‚Äù An X user wrote, ‚ÄúWhen women achieve something and men prove to be incompetent losers they imply that women have somehow scammed their way to success. Like there‚Äôs no end to their whining and playing victim.‚Äù Another user remarked, ‚ÄúHow the turntables. now you know what women were going through for centuries.‚Äù Broader Implications The debate sparked by this viral post reflects ongoing discussions about gender diversity in the workplace and educational institutions. While some view the increasing presence of women in top internships as a positive step towards equality, others see it as a potential imbalance that needs addressing. This incident also underscores the importance of fair and transparent hiring practices that prioritize merit. What's your view on this and also comment college name in comment as well so boys take admission in college üòÇ - Vikram Gaur

Software Engineer Career Path 1. Education and Skills: - A typical software engineering career starts with a degree in computer science, IT, or related fields. While many start with a bachelor‚Äôs degree, skills and certifications can sometimes be just as important as formal education. - You can also prepare through online courses, coding boot camps, and certifications like those offered by Google and IBM. 2. Entry-Level Positions: - Entry-level roles, like Junior Software Engineer or Technical Support Specialist, are where most new graduates begin. - These roles involve learning from senior engineers, testing software, and assisting in coding and troubleshooting. 3. Junior-Level Positions: - After gaining some experience (usually 1-3 years), you move into junior positions where you start writing more code independently and take on more complex tasks. - Roles may include Junior Software Engineer or Quality Assurance Tester. 4. Mid-Level Positions: - With 4-6 years of experience, mid-level positions involve more specialized work. You might contribute to project planning, lead teams, and review code. - Titles could include Mid-Level Software Engineer or Systems Engineer. 5. Senior-Level Positions: - Senior engineers (7+ years of experience) often oversee entire projects, mentor junior engineers, and set technical standards. - Senior Software Engineer or Controls Engineer are typical roles. Specializations and Industries As you progress, consider specializing in areas like: - Data Engineering: Analyzing and managing data systems. - Cybersecurity: Protecting systems from cyber threats. - FinTech: Innovating financial technology solutions. - Gaming: Developing video games and interactive software. - Systems Engineering: Optimizing computer systems and networks. Building Your Skills - Programming Languages: Learn languages like Python, Java, or C++. - Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC): Understand how software is developed from planning to maintenance. - Agile and DevOps Methodologies: Key for project management and efficient development. Resources for Learning Platforms like Coursera offer courses and certifications to enhance your skills and career prospects. Consider courses in: - Software Engineering - Data Analysis - Cybersecurity - Artificial Intelligence Salary and Skills: - Salary: Salaries can vary based on experience and location. Entry-level software engineers in the US average around $95,071 per year, while senior engineers can earn up to $134,021 per year. - Skills: Important technical skills include proficiency in programming languages (like Python or Java), familiarity with software engineering methodologies (Agile, DevOps), and understanding of systems and databases. This path offers a structured approach to building a career in software engineering, starting from foundational education to specialized roles based on your interests and expertise. Follow Vikram Gaur #SoftwareEngineering #DevOps

How to Land a Summer Internship at Goldman Sachs Hello, everyone! I‚Äôm excited to share with you some valuable insights and tips on how to secure a summer internship at Goldman Sachs, whether you‚Äôre preparing for the upcoming internship drives or simply curious about the process, this guide will provide you with a comprehensive overview. 1st Experience: Selection Procedure: - Test for Shortlisting: - Coding Section: Two medium to hard questions in C++. - Probability, Statistics, and Puzzles: 25 questions. - Essay Question: Language fluency test. - Computer Architecture: 20 questions on core CS topics. - Personal Interviews: - Two rounds of technical interviews focusing on logic-based puzzles and probability/statistics questions. - Interviewers interested in the candidate‚Äôs approach and analysis. Preparation: - Started with competitive programming after the 4th semester. - Resources: GeeksforGeeks, InterviewBit, Algorithmic Toolbox course on Coursera. - Practiced probability and puzzles from Brainstellar, Heard on the Street, and Fifty Challenging Problems in Probability. Challenges and Advice: - Managed time between preparation and extracurricular activities. - Advised connecting with seniors for insights and support. Profile Suitability: - Ideal for those with strong problem-solving abilities. 2nd Experience: Overall Hiring Process: - Aptitude test followed by Coursera preparation courses. - Coding test with DSA questions and multiple-choice questions. - Three interview rounds (two technical, one behavioral). 3. Interview Experience: - 1st Round: DSA questions, DBMS query, and 3NF. - 2nd Round: 3NF, React concepts, data structures in JavaScript. - 3rd Round: Behavioral questions using the STAR method. 4. Advice: - Emphasized clear and concise communication during interviews. - Recommended resources: GeeksforGeeks, InterviewBit, LeetCode, CSES, AlgoZenith. - Importance of practicing coding competitions and understanding core CS concepts. Additional General Advice: 1. Preparation Strategy: - Focus on mastering basic data structures and algorithms. - Participate in coding competitions to improve problem-solving skills. - Use resources like GeeksforGeeks, LeetCode, and CSES for practice. - Prepare for CS core concepts like DBMS, OOPS, and networks in the final weeks. 2. CV Building: - Structure CV based on the targeted profile. - Focus on relevant projects and internships for tech profiles. - Customize CVs for different profiles (Data, SDE, Quant). Overall, the document provides a detailed roadmap for securing an internship at Goldman Sachs, from preparation and resources to interview tips and CV building advice. Drop your email ID to receive the complete Preparation Guides resources. Join WhatsApp Community : https://lnkd.in/d7DvQAe8 Repost this and share with your juniors/seniors for good karma! üôèüèº Follow Vikram Gaur #GoldmanSachs #dsa

Recently featured on Times Square NYC Billboard ‚ù§Ô∏è It has been pretty great experience guiding and mentoring all these students. End of the day, it is not me who has reached there. It is the support of you people which made me what I am today. I hail from Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh, where my academic journey began with challenges, scoring 59.2% in Class 12th and failing twice in IIT JEE. Despite enrolling in a tier-3 college with no support, I persevered through setbacks, including three backlogs and low CGPAs. I faced eleven months of rejections before landing my first job at EY, followed by offers from Capgemini, Amdocs, Nagarro, and Infosys. The lack of support in college and personal challenges motivated me to guide students in similar situations. Achievements like being LinkedIn Top Voice '24, recognized as one of India's Top 200 LinkedIn creators and working as a Software Development Engineer at EY and a Google Cloud Facilitator , my passion for guiding students facing similar challenges drives me along with invitations from top colleges, are testament to perseverance. The ultimate success came when colleges like IITs, NITs, IIITs, VIT, Manipal, and SRM ‚Äì institutions I once dreamed of taking admission and they did not give me admission there ‚Äì invited me as a guest speaker to guide and motivate their students. This full-circle moment is a testament to the power of perseverance and dedication. I've helped many achieve their goals. Seeing my parents' pride and receiving gratitude from students are my true rewards. Thank you for your unwavering support ‚ù§Ô∏è . Today, I am living the life I manifested and worked very hard for. #SuccessStory #grateful #timesquare #billboard

From failing IIT JEE ‚Üí Tier 3 College ‚Üí Cracking companies like Amdocs, EY, Nagarro, Capgemini, etc.! My whole journey has been full of ups & downs. üòì But it‚Äôs just not me who had to go through rejections to reach their Dream company. There are many others too. I‚Äôve interacted with many working professionals who had 0 knowledge of Maths & Stats, Deep Learning, ML, etc., but who had made a great switch to the Data Science domain. Despite their preparation, they had to face rejection. Even though rejections after rejections demotivated them, they eventually learned to handle rejections. Here's what they discovered: üëâ Rejections aren't always about us. If you apply for competitive positions, it's easy to be rejected. So, instead of feeling demotivated, get back stronger. Prepare harder. üëâ Make a plan to correct your mistakes and use rejections as fuel for motivation. Remember, you don‚Äôt have to do everything alone. When you receive a rejection, try to figure out what you missed by asking a senior or mentor for help. Fortunately, they made it through and finally, step by step, reached their dream job, with the help of the mentors. Therefore, if you want to get guidance from industry veterans as well as Bosscoder Academy, I recommend taking this course. Check them here: https://bit.ly/45ZAv8I They can help you with - ‚úÖ Structured curriculum to learn Machine Learning, Generative AI, Data Visualization and more. ‚úÖ Personal Guidance from Data Analysts / Scientists working in Google, Samsung etc. ‚úÖ Multiple projects for SQL, Python etc. to build portfolio. P.S. Personal Placement Support also provided. #sponsoredpost #collab #failures #career
